title: Dropdowns on Google search results do not open
content:
Last few weeks, when I Google something on my FF 82 (fully updated) and the results page has dropdowns, the dropdowns do not open.

This continues in FF safe mode and with hardware acceleration off. (Options - General - Performance - turn off both "Use recommended performance settings" and "Use hardware acceleration when available".)

For example, I just Googled "printui.exe /s" and in the results there's a box with "People also ask ... What is Printui EXE?" with a dropdown carat, but it won't open. Left or right clicking does nothing.

Even before I tried in Safe Mode, my AdBlock was off for these search results.

What's new? I connected a new HP OfficeJet 9015 printer to my home network about three weeks ago, and it automatically puts software into my Win 10 Pro 64-bit PC (version 1909, updated through the October updates for Win 10). Could the HP printer be it? If yes, how to stop? And if I get rid of the printer, how do I reset FF to work again, ideally without losing all my add-ons?

Help, please. But please note this already continues in FF safe mode and with hardware acceleration off.

Thanks.

title: Firefox cannot focus or type properly on some text inputs fields, including duckduckgo.com
content:
Using Firefox 82.0.3 64-bit on Ubuntu, I cannot type in the search field after navigating to duckduckgo.com. The page seems to behave as if Firefox is unfocused, for instance, if I hit the space bar after clicking on the search field, the page scrolls down.

The same effect happens after I use the url/search/omni bar to search with duckduckgo. I am able to perform the initial search with the omnibar, but cannot edit the search after clicking the duckduckgo field.

I have disabled duckduckgo keyboard shortcuts.

I've also tried:

Google Chrome + duckduckgo.com search, no problem Google Chrome + google.com search, no problem Firefox + google.com search, no problem Firefox + duckduckgo.com search, yes, there's a problem Firefox + duckduckgo.com search, after refresh, yes, still a problem Firefox + duckduckgo.com search, after refresh and running in safe mode, yes, still a problem

Elsewhere, I have noticed that in some text fields in Firefox, I cannot type properly, for instance, when editing my display name in the Mozilla account customization, I couldn't type more than one letter. I had to copy-paste my display name

title: Restore session lost after Windows 10 update
content:
Hello,

I'm desperate as I've looked at past posts and answers and tried some things but it didn't help, so I decided to ask. Sorry if my explanation is long but I want to detail all the steps I already tried, in case I made a mistake somewhere.

So Windows forced me to do an update and when I restarted my computer and launched Firefox my restore session window didn't appear. Instead of the restore page I got this in the main tab: File not found Firefox can’t find the file at /C:/Program

(at that point I didn't had time to figure out the bug so I just opened new tabs and did my studies/emails) After my studies I looked in the 3-bar menu and restore session was greyed out. I then went in Help- Troubleshooting info and opened the profile folder. In the sessionstore-backups folder there was: previous.jsonlz4 recovery.baklz4 recovery.jsonlz4 There was also three upgrade.jsonlz4- followed by a string number which includes the date.

I made a backup copy on the desktop of the sessionstore-backups folder and then (after closing Firefox), deleted the 2 recovery files which where dated from after my Firefox restart and kept the previous.jsonlz4. When I reopened Firefox it opened the last session (my studies) and not the session from before the windows update.

I then closed again Firefox and wanted to try to delete the recovery files again, but then change the name of previous.jsonklz4 to recovery.jsonklz4. (at that point something weird happened. I deleted the files but the paste didn't work. When I went back on the desktop to copy again the files from my backup folder, it had totally disappeared, just like that. It was there a minute earlier. And I didn't find it in the trash).

So I changed my plan and used the files from the last session that I had just deleted. The three upgrade.jsonlz4- files where still there, so I took the most recent, dated from 2 days ago, and changed it's name from upgrade.jsonlz4-20201108180448 to recovery.jsonklz4. I then deleted all the other file in the sessionstore-backups folder. When I opened Firefox it still restored my last session from my studies, not the one from before the Windows update.

So I have two questions:

  1. Is there something I can do to restore my session from before the Windows update?
  2. How can Firefox restore my last session if I deleted all the files in the sessionstore-backups folder? Is there another file elsewhere that has my session info?

Thanks a lot in advance, Olivier

title: Some UI problems after version 82+ of Firefox
content:
I am not sure but I think that after I installed version 82 of Firefox I've started experiencing some UI problems. On many sites (in some circumstances) on their loaded pages I see 'black rectangles' which mysteriously disappear after some time as like as they previously have shown...

It is very strange and annoying. Before version 82 I have no memory to see that before. I don't know what Firefox developers do, but if their job is to decrease user level of satisfaction of using Firefox browser, than they give their best.

These randomly appeared black rectangles on different pages make me nervous. They are like some missing part of a page. Like Firefox, on its desire to show site content as soon as possible, doesn't wait to receive all data packages and on later period (when delayed packages arrive) then fill the black rectangles with data and the pages are represented as they should be. My International Internet Connection is around 20 Mbps and my Homeland Internet Connection is around 50 Mbps, so I don't think that Internet Connection is the reason for these black rectangles. I've set Google as my home page and these black rectangles show even on Firefox starting process when Firefox loads Google site. I don't keep sites' cache data. And I am very curious why on earlier versions of Firefox I didn't notice these black rectangles.
creator: mks19

title: Autofill on Input Type "search" doesn't work anymore in version 82
content: Since Firefox version 82, the possibility of autofill username on some specific input fields (<input type="search">) doesn't work anymore (while <input type="text"> still works). It allways worked fine for me to use the saved username and password, automaticly filled in on both of the text fields (of course, the password field is of type "password"). I checked Firefox version 81, where "search" input fields still worked for autofill, so version 82 must have been updated on this topic, but I can't understand why (perhaps there is a good reason to inactivate this input type for autofill)..

title: Web pages doesn't open. when they do it's a lot slower than using edge.
content:
Hi, I'm currently trying to use Firefox becouse I've heard a lot of good things about it and it looked good. I have some problems that may make me go back to Microsoft Edge.

1 - When using Microsoft Edge in background, I get 0 latency in game, like really 0 effective ms increase even with multiple tabs opened (playing youtube's videos an so on). This doesn't apply to Firefox (neither Chrome), cause I get a lot of latency from just having google opened in the background. 2 - A LOT of the time, when i click on a link, or open a bookmark or just open a site from results, I get a white tab that will not going to load... It just stays there with the correct URL that I've clicked but the web page doesn't load. To counter this, I have to open multiple tabs or even restart Firefox entirely. 3 - When pages does load, I cannot say that this browser can go as fast as Edge. Youtube puts me at 144p, and when I go higher, it starts to buffer every couple of seconds... this on Edge doesn't happen at all. I whatch 1080p video with little to no interruption all the time.

I started having problems with YouTube recently and I think it is a Firefox issue.

I am running version 82.0.3 (64-bit) and when I log into YouTube, the Home page is not displaying all the content.

I have attached severl screenshots and you can see the problem as follows:

Image Sign In 1 shows the YouTube home page before signing in. Image Sign In 2 shows the YouTube home page after I have signed in using my Google account and you can see at the top right of the screen that my Google Account avatar (Darth) is showing. However, a lot of the content, e.g. Watch Later, Classics and My Subscriptions which are user related are all missing and if you compare this image to Image Sign In Chrome you can see that Chrome is showing everything and works correctly.

I tried this on Edge as well and it works all okay, the same as Chrome, so that is why I think there is an issue with Firefox.

Also, on the left side in the middle in Image Sign In 1 and Image Sign In 2 you can see a blue Sign In box with the words "Sign in to like videos, comment and subscribe." If you select this option you get an error which is in Image YouTube Sign In Error so I don't know if this is related to my problem but I thought it may help highlight what the problem is.

Any confirmation that it's a Firefox issue or any solutions to what is causing it would be appreciated.

Thanks.

content: I have been requested to uninstall Adobe Flash player. I am still using Flash Player for some web sites and am ask to activate before video will work. I have also checked several sites to see what can be done with Firefox to continue watching video without changing browsers. I wish Firefox would put out a step by step process to fix this problem and allow me to use html5 in a Firefox browser. I am reluctant to uninstall Flash Player until I understand how to make html5 or whatever is required to continue to watch live stream and youtube. It looks like I have until January before Flash Player is inoperative. BTW, I have Firefox version 82, running Win10 with Shockwave Flash 32.0 r0. Jay

title: Multi-Account Containers Bug
content:
There seems to be a bug with multi-account containers that has been around for a while. I'm not sure what I'm doing to break it, or it was always broken. All the containers work correctly for me and I love them, but it seems that most of the time when I am trying to leave a container, it won't let me leave.

I can change containers to other containers, but when I choose "no container" it seems to always just duplicate the tab in the exact same container rather than leaving it. It always seems to open a duplicate tab outside the container for just a second, then close that tab and replace it with a duplicate tab still inside the same container. Very strange behavior.

Thank you for your time and work!

title: Initiating sync makes my entire computer slow and almost unresponsive
content:
This seems to be a newish issue - as in, I think it has not been happening until at least a few weeks ago. The computer (linux) is always on, and firefox is also always running (except when I update to a new version). But I was not using the computer for a while. Today I sat at the computer expecting to see all my tabs that I sent to it via "send tab to device", but as soon as firefox started syncing, everything slowed down to a crawl (to the point where even typing to a terminal would have upwards to several seconds of lag). Weirdly, it doesn't seem as if there's a lot of CPU or IO being used, according to top and iotop - but I was seeing multiple "migration" processes (that went away after quitting firefox), suggesting that there are many threads doing very little work in aggregate. After googling a bit I tried setting sync.log.appender.console to Debug and looking at debug console, which didn't tell me anything interesting - it actually looks as if the sync itself completes fast. And, in fact, my bookmarks seem to have synced to today's state correctly. (restarting after updating to current version does not seem to help; running in safe mode also doesn't seem to help)

1) What's up? How do I stop this from happening?

2) How do I get my "sent" tabs? Even a list for the past 2 weeks would be fine. Working it out from browsing history would be ... a lot of needles in even more piles of hay.
creator: xKiv

title: Move thunderbird profile from one partition C with all apps to another partition Y with all files/data
content:
I'm stumped. Using this URL https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/back-and-restore-information-firefox-profiles I've backed up files to an external drive. Then followed the instructions "Restoring to a different location" which in my case is another partition on the same hard drive. It just does not work.

I create a new folder, Thunderbird, and a new profile in it on Y using the link in the instructions @ 2. Use the Thunderbird Profile Manager to create a new profile in your desired location by ... Press Windows Key +R on the keyboard to open the Run dialog. Then enter "thunderbird.exe -p" and click OK. exit the Profile Manager ...

Profile created and I see the file in Thunderbird folder on Y drive, path Y\Jim\Thunderbird\t55nr5v1.jim-combined. Profile manager sees default profile name on c partition and new profile on y partition. Try to launch Thunderbird with jim-combined profile. I deselect use selected profile at startup and start.

First time no start up-no error messages. Second dbl click it starts to default on c partition. A t55nr5v1.jim-combined folder has been created in the Y partition but at the root folder, Jim, and not in the Thunderbird folder that was selected when creating the new profile-this folder is MT.

I re-open the profile manager as above, thunderbird.exe -p, and the new profile created is no where to be found. I start the program from here and default on C opens.

Close program, move t55nr5v1.jim-combined, which has a file times.json in, in to the Thunderbird folder as originally set up and open profile mgr. Nothing.

I do not think Thunderbird can work on a drive that is partitioned? If it can can someone tell me how. I've lost hours and my C partition is out of space and the 2+ GB of files needs to move.

I tried another section that was on this page a few days ago but is now gone that talked about editing the the profile.int. Tried all the iterations of // or \\ absolute to relative paths, changing to 1 to 0 all w/o any luck.

This page, https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer, was much more helpful at showing what going up 3 levels means. The way the help page I'm using is written it very unclear to me.

Any help would be appreciated -- jim
creator: jkreider

title: Youtube not working, can only play videos
content: Hello everyone. For the last few days Youtube is not working properly on Firefox. The only thing I can do is search for and watch videos. I can't access settings, notifications, or my account. The toolbar on the left side of the page (where your history, playlists, and subscriptions are) works for me most of the time, but not always. Whenever I try to open those menus I just getting the little spinning wheel. I can't post or edit comments (I can see them though). Live chats don't work either, it always says I'm disconnected. I've tried everything I can think of to solve it, but nothing has worked. I've cleared all my cookies and cache (multiple times), I've tried booting it up in Safe Mode (the problem is still present there), disabling ad blocker, nothing works. The problem does not exist in any other browser or on my iPhone. Anyone have any ideas of what to do? I'd hate to run two browsers just for one site and I don't want to switch away from Firefox.
